com.hoddmimes.tcpip

Interface TcpIpConnectionInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    TcpIpCountingInterface

    public interface TcpIpConnectionInterface
extends TcpIpCountingInterface
    Interface to tcp/ip transport handle. The transport handle are created for outgoing client connections TcpIpClient.connect(TcpIpConnectionTypes, String, int, TcpIpConnectionCallbackInterface) or for inbound connection accepted TcpIpServerCallbackInterface

      • write

        void write(byte[] pBuffer,
           boolean pFlush)
    throws java.io.IOException
        Send data to counterpart.
        Parameters:
        pBuffer - byte vector to be sent to counterpart.
        pFlush - flag to indicate if a flush is to be performed after data is written to the socket.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception throw in case of failure during transmission of data.

      • write

        void write(byte[] pBuffer,
           int pOffset,
           int pLength,
           boolean pFlush)
    throws java.io.IOException
        Send data to counterpart.
        Parameters:
        pBuffer - byte vector to be sent to counterpart.
        pOffset - starting position within vector
        pLength - length of data to be sent
        pFlush - flag to indicate if a flush is to be performed after data is written to the socket.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception throw in case of failure during transmission of data.

      • write

        void write(byte[] pBuffer)
    throws java.io.IOException
        Send data to counterpart. Flush of data is implicit.
        Parameters:
        pBuffer - byte vector to be sent to counterpart.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception throw in case of failure during transmission of data.
